isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - TROUBLESHOOTING - 2000, 4000 & 8000 MODELS - TROUBLESHOOTING - DIAGNOSTICS

svcprocinfo.para: All diagnostics begins by observing the ABS Warning Light and the Traction Active Light located on the instrument panel. While the controller diagnostic display locates a specific problem area, it is necessary to confirm whether the problem is in the component or the connecting circuits. The diagnostic tables, beginning with INITIAL START-UP TEST PROCEDURE guide the technician to the specific fault.

svcsubproc.title: Important

step1.para: Determine if the vehicle has traction control installed. With traction control there will be a Traction Active light and ON/OFF switch on the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.para: Place the traction control ON/OFF switch in the ON position, before beginning troubleshooting.

step1.para: Before beginning these test procedures, make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Before beginning these test procedures, check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Before beginning these test procedures, inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the mechanic determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the mechanic knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.
Begin the troubleshooting process by performing INITIAL START-UP TEST PROCEDURE.
The service technician should record all findings and action taken during troubleshooting.
No voltage or resistance tests are performed into the controller. All tests in this manual will be on the vehicle harness side of controller connectors (277) and (288).
